content:
Sure, here's the updated grading rubric with the performance levels changed to Excellent, Good, and Developing:

| Criteria | Excellent (3) | Good (2) | Developing (1) |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Frequency of Posts | Student posts frequently and consistently throughout the week, often responding to peers in a timely manner. | Student posts somewhat frequently throughout the week, but may miss a day or fail to respond to peers in a timely manner. | Student posts infrequently throughout the week, may fail to respond to peers, or does not post at all. |
| Quality of Posts | Student consistently provides well-reasoned, well-supported, and engaging posts that contribute significantly. | Student provides satisfactory, relevant posts that may lack depth or insight in some cases. | Student provides inadequate, poorly reasoned, or off-topic posts that do not contribute significantly to the discussion. |
| Relevance to Topic | Student consistently posts relevant and insightful comments that advance the discussion and add value to the class. | Student posts comments that are generally relevant, but may not add significant value to the class. | Student posts comments that are largely irrelevant, off-topic, or do not contribute to the class in a meaningful way. |
| Peer Interaction | Student consistently interacts with peers and contributes thoughtfully to the discussion, providing insightful feedback. | Student interacts with peers, but may not consistently contribute thoughtful or insightful feedback. | Student does not interact with peers, provides no feedback, or does not contribute to the discussion in a meaningful way. |
| Writing Clarity | Student's writing is clear, concise, and free of errors in grammar, spelling, and punctuation. | Student's writing is generally clear, but may contain some errors in grammar, spelling, or punctuation. | Student's writing is difficult to read due to errors in grammar, spelling, or punctuation. |
| Overall Guidelines | Student consistently follows all guidelines and instructions for the assignment. | Student generally follows guidelines and instructions for the assignment, but may miss a few minor details. | Student does not follow guidelines and instructions for the assignment, or makes significant errors in understanding the assignment. |
| Total | 60 | 40 | 22 |
